definition.name: NXcollectioncolumn
definition.doc: Subclass of NXelectronanalyser to describe the electron collection column of a photoelectron analyser.

field.name: scheme
field.doc: Scheme of the electron collection lens, i.e. standard, deflector, PEEM, momentum microscope, etc.

field.name: extractor_voltage
field.doc: Voltage applied to the extractor lens

field.name: extractor_current
field.doc: Current necessary to keep the extractor lens at a set voltage. Variations indicate leakage, field emission or arc currents to the extractor lens.

field.name: working_distance
field.doc: Distance between sample and detector entrance

field.name: mode
field.doc: Labelling of the lens setting in use.

field.name: projection
field.doc: The space projected in the angularly dispersive directions, real or reciprocal

field.name: magnification
field.doc: The magnification of the electron lens assembly.

field.name: depends_on
field.doc: Specifies the position of the collectioncolumn by pointing to the last transformation in the transformation chain in the NXtransformations group.

group.doc: Collection of axis-based translations and rotations to describe the location and geometry of the deflector as a component in the instrument. Conventions from the NXtransformations base class are used. In principle, the McStas coordinate system is used. The first transformation has to point either to another component of the system or . (for pointing to the reference frame) to relate it relative to the experimental setup. Typically, the components of a system should all be related relative to each other and only one component should relate to the reference coordinate system.
The size and position of an aperture inserted in the column, e.g. field aperture or contrast aperture
Deflectors in the collection column section
Individual lenses in the collection column section
